title: Double-clicking a folder shortcut tries to upload the shortcut instead of opening the folder
content:
This is a problem I only started experiencing yesterday, but if I try to upload an image to a website (such as social media), and I double-click a shortcut for a folder, it attempts to upload the shortcut as the selected file, instead of opening the folder.

This is only a problem with firefox, as I tried doing this in another browser and I was able to open it as a folder normally. Any ideas on what could be causing this or how to fix this?
creator: umbreonitis

title: Cannot connect using Tabs.
content: Tabs not opening. Cleared cache and history. Also went to "Trouble Shoot" restore did not work. Uninstalled then reinstalled. Still did not work. Changed Profile. Still not working. Got to this website by typing in website using Safari.
creator: dlevinca7

title: Update v137.0 broke streaming DRM-content for me, now always in low quality
content:
Hello,

Sorry if this is not the right place to report this, this is my first time and im lost between all these 3 different pages "Discussions/Support/Bugzilla".

The latest Firefox (v137.0) update for Windows 11 that I installed today broke something possibly related to DRM-protected content, at least for me. Now whenever I start streaming live sports, the video always plays in the lowest quality (possibly even lower than the lowest option available in the player, for some reason?).

I tried to restart my PC, clear the cookies for that streaming website, disable all my extensions, but same issue. On my other browsers everything works fine as always, so only Firefox got broken after this last update.

I have both of these options turned ON even before the update: - Use recommended performance settings (Hardware acceleration). - Play DRM-controlled content.

Why do I think it's related to DRM? Because I can now record and take a screenshot of the video, unlike before the update where it always turned into a black screen.

Help please!
creator: BlackEdition

title: Lost all my bookmarks, history and password with an update that I did not authorize.
content: I have been using the old version of firefox for many years now. It seems that I am now synched in with my work version which I did not authorize. When the work version was updated it also updated my home version (which is a DISASTER for me. When it did this it also removed all of my saved passwords, my bookmarks, and my history. Is there any way I can recover any of these super important items. This just happened today. If I had been given any warning that this was going to happen I would have backed up all of this. As it is now. I have no way to do any of my crucial on line banking, or any of my other super important items.
creator: dansheets

title: Where is my add blocker and how to disable it ??
content:
I have used Firefox for years and I enjoy the variety of articles that are available to read when I first sign on.

But more and more sites request me to "Please Disable your Add Blocker" and will not let me read the article without doing so

That's fine with me but when I look at my "Extensions" list I do not find any Add Blocker on my Firefox

So...How can I disable it ??

title: Change Tab Size and Scroll Speed
content:
When opening several tabs they start to shrink down to the browser.tabs.tabMinWidth for which the default is too small for my sensibility. I've tried messing with it to make it more tolerable but what I really would like is to be able to set the tabs to not change size at all. I would like them to stay the default size. Of course let users have smaller tabs if they like, but let us not if we don't want it.

My second issue is when you have many tabs open and you scroll through them with the mouse wheel, it scrolls 6 tabs at a time per mouse wheel input. I would like it to do 1 tab per mouse wheel input just like if I was clicking on the arrows at the top to scroll through tabs. It just makes sense to stay consistent or to have an option in the config that controls tab scrolling.

These are things users used to have control over and were removed. Unless a setting in about:config was renamed to something weird and I'm just missing it, the settings that replaced these options are insufficient.

title: Is there a way to download all of my bookmarks into a CSV file to reorganize them
content:
I have hundreds of bookmarks imported from Google Chrome, Safari and Firefox on older computers. Many of the bookmarks are duplicates, and many located in different, misnamed sub-folders should be moved to more relevant folders.

The bookmark manager is not the easiest tool to use for reorganizing bookmarks because the Results Detail section changes its focus each time a bookmark file is dragged to a different folder or sub-folder. This forces the user to bounce back and forth in the Bookmark Manager in attempts to find the sub-folder they cleaning up.

If the contents of the Bookmark Manager could be downloaded as a CSV file or spreadsheet; more query tools could be implemented to reorganize the data. Once that is accomplished; the Bookmark Manager could be purged and the organized data could be reinstalled. That would make the Bookmark Manager operate more efficiently and therefore more quickly.

title: Firefox not caching 303 redirects
content:
I work with a web platform where images can be optionally served from cloud storage, S3 in our case. This redirects image requests to a URL containing a dynamic signature which changes per request. For example, to load an image, the browser might do:

-> GET https://www.example.com/file.php/image01.jpg <- HTTP/2 303 See Other 

 expires: Thu, 03 Apr 2025 11:23:44 GMT  cache-control: public, max-age=14400  location: https://[site].amazonaws.com/...filename%3D%22image01.jpg%22&X-Amz-Signature=...123

and the browser follows the redirect to get the image:

-> GET https://[site].amazonaws.com/...filename%3D%22image01.jpg%22&X-Amz-Signature=...123 <- 200 OK

But if I refresh the page the signature is now different:

-> GET https://www.example.com/file.php/image01.jpg <- HTTP/2 303 See Other 

 expires: Thu, 03 Apr 2025 11:24:03 GMT  cache-control: public, max-age=14400  location: https://[site].amazonaws.com/...filename%3D%22image01.jpg%22&X-Amz-Signature=...abc

The browser doesn't have this URL cached so it again fetches the image:

-> GET https://[site].amazonaws.com/...filename%3D%22image01.jpg%22&X-Amz-Signature=...abc <- 200 OK

In Firefox that is. In Chrome there's the same following of the redirect when the page is first loaded, but when the page is refreshed the redirect has been cached:

-> GET https://www.example.com/file.php/image01.jpg <- HTTP/2 303 See Other (from disk cache) 

 location: https://[site].amazonaws.com/...filename%3D%22image01.jpg%22&X-Amz-Signature=...123

Since the redirect is now to the same URL the image is fetched from the browser cache. Obviously subsequent page loads are faster on Chrome, much faster on image-heavy pages (for example, 6 seconds on Chrome, 1+ minutes on Firefox).

Is there anything I can do to improve this?

Tested with Firefox 136.0.2 and Chrome 134.0.6998.35.

This looks a little bit like [https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1889840 #1889840 will never use an entry in the image cache when loading an image top level that has a redirect] but I think that's referring to images with static URLs.
creator: leon.stringer

title: Windows shortcuts .lnk stopped working in Windows Firefox 137
content: Hello, After installing Firefox 137, Windows shortcuts stopped working within Firefox: for example I am on Google Mail writing a new email. If I want to attach a file to my email, I click on the classic paper clip, it opens a windows dialog box to browse my files and folders. Up to now, if I did double-click on a shortcut (a .lnk file) it would follow the shortcut (like if it was a folder shortcut it would open the corresponding folder) for me to choose a file ... As of 137 it attaches the shortcut, and tries to attach the whole content of the folder ! I tried the same operation on Chrome, it works ok. I tried the same operation on a different service on Firefox (Mattermost) I have the same problem, so my guess is that the problem is with Firefox 137. (this has been working properly for the last 10 years at least). And I made the test on MacOS, no problem, it's really with Firefox 137 on Windows. Anybody else seeing this ?
creator: pierrot2

title: Miten saan laajennuskuvakkeet näkymään yläoikealla laajennusvalikossa
content:
Miten siis saan laajennuskuvakkeet näkymään yläoikealla laajennusvalikossa. Orefs.js ja user.is alkavat olla niin solmussa ettei tähän saa tolkkua. Ensin tuo valikko siirtyi väärälle kohdalle näyttöä, ja näkyi vain osittain. Tarkoirus on saada se näkymään niin, että aktiiviset laajennnukset näkyvät yläoikealla ja ovat helposti valittavissa. Edelleen sen vaatiman alueen tulee skaalautua niin, että se pienentää tarpeensa mukaan osoiterivin varaamaa tilaa eli että kaikissa olosuhteissa kaikki valitut aktiiviset (passiivisetkin ehkä?) ovat laajennusriviltä valittavissa, aktivoitavissa tai passivoitavissa sekä näiden keskenäinen järjestys muokattavissa.

Ethän vain palaa kertomaan ettei kysymyksiä voi esittää suomeksi, vaan ainoastaan englanniksi, kiitos.

Yt. KP
